WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex issues and suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some issues and feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
Hi, 

TS Version: 1.01
VS Version: 2013 Ultimate spring update 2014

Here is the repro

* Open up the attached project FooProj in visual studio.
* Build the project and open up the generated declarations file "bin\FooProj.d.ts"; the file should contain

```TypeScript
/// <reference path="../bar.d.ts" />
/// <reference path="../foo.d.ts" />
```

* Open bar.d.ts then save the file in order to trigger compile-on-save (you may have to save it twice).
* Open up "bin\FooProj.d.ts" again and observe that the file is now empty.

The expected behaviour is for the file to contain the reference paths as in step 2.

This causes problems in the setup we have, because "FooProj.d.ts" is referenced by other projects, which start reporting compilation errors because the types in "bar.d.ts" and "foo.d.ts" are not visible.

Thanks.
WorkItem.Summary: Faulty declarations file generated from compile-on-save
